result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

records.addlTxt:
1:55 PM Defendant Jeremy J Imhoff in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has applied for SPD, but no one is appointed yet.  Case rescheduled.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

Prior: 2001 Traceway Dr #221, Fitchburg, WI 53713
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _x_ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Gregory B or Jacob B. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

01:35 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kara M Rolf.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
